snippet: The escalation of tensions comes as the foreign ministries on both sides issued tough statements over Pakistan’s plans to meet with Kashmiri separatist leaders.
abstract: Scheduled talks between India and Pakistan may collapse due to escalated tensions caused by Pakistan’s plans to meet with members of All Parties Hurriyat Conference, umbrella group of separatist leaders in Indian-administered Kashmir.

byline.contributor: Salman Masood contributed reporting from Islamabad, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: The escalation of tensions comes as the foreign ministries on both sides issued tough statements over Pakistan’s plans to meet with Kashmiri separatist leaders.

headline.main: Trading Barbs, India and Pakistan Seem on Verge of Canceling Talks
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; India: Talks With Pakistan Falter
